intro: Ouratea venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan ouratea, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and neighboring countries. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it often grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
